#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=AN IDYL
#Text=OF PLAIN PEOPLE
#Text=Hilda had not spent her nineteen years in the glare of the Spartan publicity in which the masses live without establishing a character .
#Text=Just as she knew all the good points and bad in all the people of that community , so they knew all hers , and therefore knew what it was possible for her to do and what impossible .
#Text=And if a baseless lie is swift of foot where everybody minutely scrutinizes everybody else , it is also scant of breath .
#Text=Sophie 's scandal soon dwindled to a whisper and expired , and the kindlier and probable explanation of Hilda 's wan face and downcast eyes was generally accepted .
#Text=Her code of morals and her method of dealing with moral questions were those of all the people about her -- strict , severe , primitive .
#Text=Feuerstein was a cheat , a traitor .
#Text=She cast him out of her heart -- cast him out at once and utterly and for ever .
#Text=She could think of him only with shame .
#Text=And it seemed to her that she was herself no longer pure -- she had touched pitch ; how could she be undefiled ?
#Text=She accepted these conclusions and went about her work , too busy to indulge in hysteria of remorse , repining , self-examination .
#Text=She avoided Otto , taking care not to be left alone with him when he called on Sundays , and putting Sophie between him and her when he came up to them in the Square .
#Text=But Otto was awaiting his chance , and when it came , plunged boldly into his heart-subject and floundered bravely about .
#Text=" I do n't like to see you so sad , Hilda .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=Hilda shook her head sadly .

#Text= I 'm never going to marry , " she said .

column1: #Text=" You must find some one else .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text= I suppose I ought to tell you , " she said , half to herself .

column1: #Text=She turned to him suddenly , and , with flushed cheeks and eyes that shifted , burst out :
#Text=" Otto , he was a married man !

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text= It does n't change the way I feel .

_	_	_	_

#Text= I would , " he said , " and I do .

column1: #Text=" And we know all about each other .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=She did not speak for several minutes .

#Text= You know I have n't any heart to give you , " she answered at last .

column1: #Text=Otto did not know anything of the kind , but he knew she thought so , and he was too intelligent to dispute , when time would settle the question -- and , he felt sure , would settle it right .
#Text=So he reached out and took her hand and said :
#Text=" I 'll risk that .
